text:
"I argued it all over," he whispered in the dark. 

"I wanted to forget, Sonia. Start anew."

"You didn’t go in like a fool?" she asked, wide-eyed.

"I went in like a wise man. That was my destruction."

He paused, wrestling with his thoughts. 

"I questioned my right to power. I knew I didn’t have it."

"Then why?" Sonia clasped her hands.

"I wanted to murder for myself. No lies, no excuses."

"It wasn’t for my mother or wealth. It was for me."

His voice dropped. 

"I wanted to be free of it all."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on his motivations for murder, admitting it was for himself alone rather than for any noble cause.
